narrative=Nathan Read, a 96-year-old retired therapist, was last seen at his home on Wester Millerhill, Dalkeith. He is known to have a pattern of squatting in derelict or abandoned places due to his belief in non-traditional living arrangements. His absence was reported by Robin Quinn, a friend who visited the home. Robin noted that Nathan often explored the areas around Dalkeith and Edinburgh. It was suspected that he might have been squatting near St Leonard's Crag, Edinburgh, as he occasionally wandered off to such locations. After an extensive search, Nathan was found safe and well by staff at 19 West Port, Dunbar, unharmed and feeling quite at home.

narrative=Nathan Read was reported missing after failing to collect his medication. He was last seen boarding a train near Mid Road, Prestonpans, EH32 9ER. It was believed that Nathan might have been squatting at 23a Rosebery Avenue, South Queensferry, EH30 9JG due to his son mentioning his fondness for the area. Concerns arose given his age and need for medication. Thankfully, after a thorough search, Nathan was safely traced by police at 19 West Port, Dunbar, where he'd been staying temporarily without incident.

narrative=Nathan Read was last confirmed seen by a friend, Lauren Rogers, at the adult day care facility he frequently visited. Known to sometimes enjoy solitude, Nathan left alone, planning to take a familiar train journey near his regular walking route. On this occasion, he intended to visit a remote cabin, a location he often spoke of with his brother. Concerns arose when Nathan failed to return and missed several engagements with his son. Tracing his steps, police discovered Nathan had not reached the cabin. A thorough check of the train routes and nearby areas led to his safe return, slightly disoriented but unharmed.

narrative=Nathan Read was reported missing after being last seen leaving his home in Wester Millerhill, Dalkeith. Concerned family members, including his son and brother, noted that Nathan had a history of frequent visits to a remote cabin near 2 Cramond Glebe Road, Edinburgh. He was believed to be squatting in various locations across the city and was known for his illegal employment status, which added complexity to his whereabouts. A friend had mentioned Nathan's interest in the art scene around 91,93 Princes Street, adding to the mystery of his disappearance. After an extensive search, including known areas of refuge, he was eventually traced by police at 19 West Port, Dunbar, safe and unharmed, much to the relief of his family. Despite his wandering tendencies, Nathan expressed gratitude upon his return and promised to be more communicative regarding his whereabouts.

narrative=Nathan Read was last seen by his friend Clare on his regular walking route, failing to collect essential medication from the doctor's office. With an illegal employment status impacting his mobility, he was traced by police at 50 Howden Hall Road, Edinburgh, safe and unharmed after an initial medium risk assessment.

narrative=Nathan Read was last seen leaving his home in Wester Millerhill, Dalkeith. He had a scheduled appointment at the doctor's office, but never arrived, leading his family to grow concerned. Reports from his son and brother highlighted his recent tendency to avoid collecting his prescribed medication. Concerned for his well-being, they alerted the authorities. Investigations revealed that Nathan might have been squatting at an address on Abbotsford Road, North Berwick. After days of searching, he was eventually located by the police at 50 Howden Hall Road, Edinburgh. Throughout his brief disappearance, Nathan appeared to have deliberately avoided contact but was found safe and in good health, with no immediate medical concerns upon his return.
